titleInfo.title: Louisianans in the Military Oral History Project
titleInfo.subTitle: Nell Byars oral history interview, 1997

name.description: Nell Byars was born in Shreveport, La., in 1925. She graduated from Baton Rouge High School and married Vance Byars in 1943. She kept the account books for his Baton Rouge medical practice that he began in 1960.

subject.topic: Wives--Effect of husband's employment on--United States.

mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries Special Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special)
mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright is retained by Louisiana State University in accordance with U.S. copyright laws.

"E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments. See instructions for ordering reprints of this audio here: http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special/services/duplication.html Mention the ""Item number"" or ""Item URL"" in your request. "
mods.abstract: Byars discusses her family; her father's immigration from Italy to Louisiana, his shoe store, and his early death in a trolley accident; her home life and education in Baton Rouge; the effects of the war on the preparation for her wedding; following her husband to different posts and writing one another during the war; Baton Rouge during the war; her husband's return and their life together after the war; and her husband's medical education in New Orleans and practice in Baton Rouge.
